Global Markets

Africa

Africa is comprised of more than 50 countries and is the second largest continent in terms of size and population, making it an appealing market.

Because of the assorted composition of countries, many regulations vary from country to country.

Australia

Since its formation more than 10 years ago, the Australian Communications and Media Authority has stated to be, and be recognised as, the world's best converged communications regulator.

Australia has enacted diverse regulatory legislature due to the ACMA's converged nature.

China

China, the world’s second largest economy has no official Mutual Recognition Agreement with any other countries.

Despite it being member of WTO, the regulatory framework in China can be intimidating if one attempts to accede to this market.

New Zealand

From a primarily agricultural economy, New Zealand has broadened it's industrial sector to increase its competitive ability in the global market.

Currently, the telecommunications market is very competitive in New Zealand due to wholesale telecommunication services.

Russia

Russia, the world’s largest nation, borders European and Asian countries as well as the Pacific and Arctic oceans.

Getting into Russia market could be very challenge not only due to the language barrier but also the complicated certification schemes.

Saudi Arabia

The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is the fastest growing telecom market in the Middle East.

The Communication and Information Technology Commission requires all radio frequency devices to be approved before being imported.

Singapore

As a one of the most financially prosperous countries in the world, Singapore is a dynamic cluster of international trade.

Changes to the regulatory process came with a recent merger between certification bodies in Singapore.

Taiwan

Just 50 years after the establishment of Taiwan's provincial government, the Bureau of Standards, Metrology, and Inspection was established for safety and compatibility.

Shortly after, the National Communications Commission was established for wireless and telecommunication devices.

Your Global Market Access Specialists


Since regulations and definitions of compliance vary, our expert team maintains a working knowledge of each system and stays up to date on the recents changes in order to find the best way to help you obtain and maintain compliance for your products.
